content.question: If <math alttext="f of x, equals, the fraction with numerator sine x, minus 1, and denominator cosine squared, of x, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>, then <math alttext="the limit as x approaches, pi over 2, of, f of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></munder><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is equivalent to which of the following?

choices.label: <math alttext="the limit as x approaches, pi over 2, of, the fraction with numerator negative 1, and denominator 1 plus, sine x, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></munder><mfrac><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the limit as x approaches, pi over 2, of, the fraction with numerator sine x, minus 1, and denominator 1 plus, sine squared, of x, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></munder><mfrac><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the limit as x approaches, pi over 2, of, secant x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></munder><mi>sec</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the limit as x approaches, pi over 2, of, open parenthesis, tangent x, minus secant x, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></munder><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>tan</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>sec</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the limit as x approaches, pi over 2, of, the fraction with numerator negative 1, and denominator 1 plus, sine x, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></munder><mfrac><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></math>

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the classification of a given expression (e.g., Use the chain rule to find the derivative of a composite function).
